definition: to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
to parade (a prisoner) through the streets

sentences.english: Whenever Gaddafi visited Italy, he was paraded as a guest of honor.
sentences.chinese: 每當卡扎菲訪問意大利，他被遊街當作榮譽嘉賓。

sentences.english: Local authorities require the family of the condemned, including young children, to stand in the front row of spectators.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府要求其家庭連坐，包括兒童都要遊街。

sentences.english: The criminals were paraded in chains through the crowded streets.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯帶着鐐銬被押着列隊遊街示衆。

sentences.english: Now, go out about the town covered in the horsehair sheet holding the horse’s head up on a pike.
sentences.chinese: 現在用長矛舉着披着馬毛牀單的馬頭去遊街吧。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 抓獲的罪犯被遊街示衆。

sentences.english: The captured criminals were paraded through the main streets.
sentences.chinese: 被抓獲的犯人列隊遊街示衆。

sentences.english: Indeed, why not the patrons and the pimps?
sentences.chinese: 說真的，爲什麼老鴇和皮條客沒有遊街呢？

sentences.english: Sometimes you even see him parading down Main Street on stilts.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，你甚至可以看到他遊街下來高蹺大街。

sentences.english: When the boys returned home, they were paraded through the streets.
sentences.chinese: 球隊回到家鄉後遊街慶祝。

definition: lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to attack with a bladed weapon
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
